{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3294434,"name":"ThatAlo","username":"ThatAlo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatalo/{size}/214544_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-25T20:00:38.281Z","cooked":"

I just updated the motors in our swerve modules to 2024 code, but i’ve run into a few issues. Most importantly, the talonFX controllers now work in units of turns instead of sensor ticks. I’ve managed to convert most everything else over, but I’m stuck on the PID values. Is there an easy way to use last years known values with the new sensor units, or will I have to tune them again. Or am I just barking up the wrong tree?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-01-25T20:00:38.281Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":218,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":1126.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452015,"topic_slug":"pid-value-changes-with-phoenix-6","display_username":"ThatAlo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pid-value-changes-with-phoenix-6/452015/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3294478,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-25T20:43:46.810Z","cooked":"

Driving PID is something that should be retuned every year as the robot/mechanism changes. Your overall weight, COG, gearboxes, etc will affect how the robot drives. Maybe not by an astronomical amount, but enough where it’s just good practice.

I would still look at trying to start from your previous values and adjust from there as a starting point. PID constants are relative to the units going in as your input. You may not need to scale them to see the same effects though.

At least that’s what I would do, idk what other teams would do.

Edit: the answer below me is definitely better.

CTRE has a calculator on their website to convert PID values to match Phoenix 6: Closed-Loop Control

Note that the converted gains for velocity loops may be too conservative given the new default filtering settings on Phoenix 6 devices. Velocity feedback can typically be much more aggressive with the new 1ms default filter lag than with the old ~80ms default.
